page.title: 21Bognor Regis in 2011
page.content:
Bognor has the liveliest nightlife in west sussex owing to its 3 nightclubs and many pubs and bars. The 3 nightclubs are: Club Vision (the biggest one, previously known as Sheiks up to late 2010), Club Shine and Ground Zero many people pre drink at the Hatters inn ( a short 2 min walk away from Vision) the unicorn or the William Hardwicke before going on to the nightclubs, this lively nightlife comes at a price however as there is always a heavy police presence on friday and saturday nights to deter crime.

Bognor is well known for its large amount of eastern european immagrants and is known locally by the nickname "Polski Regis" as a result. There are a few Polish shops selling eastern european goods and it is very common to hear polish being spoken on the streets of Bognor.

Bognor was recently mentioned on the news as having one of the worst unemployment rates in west sussex and as a result, the local "Jobcentre plus" is always busy.

Bognor has a train station with 3 platforms and is the end of the line for all trains arriving in Bognor, most commuters have to change trains at Barnham due to the fact that Bognor station is a final stop station and is not connected directly to the main lines to London and Portsmouth.

Bognor is a suntrap and as a result enjoys a heavy tourist presence in the summer helped by the local Butlins holiday park.
